description: The Biosos initiative focuses on transforming organic waste into valuable products, such as animal protein and fertilizer, through an innovative process involving the larvae of the black soldier fly. Located in a rural area between Buga and Tulu√°, the initiative emerged from a group of entrepreneurs who sought to address the significant amount of organic waste generated by hotels and restaurants. Initially driven by economic necessity rather than sustainability, the project evolved to incorporate environmentally friendly practices as they recognized the potential benefits of recycling organic materials. The entrepreneurs have faced various challenges, including reliance on government funding and competition from traditional livestock feed producers. Despite these hurdles, they have established partnerships with local authorities and other green initiatives, positioning themselves as a reference point in sustainable practices within their community. Their future goals include scaling production and enhancing marketing efforts to achieve greater operational sustainability.
name: Biosos
